name: Guild Wars 2
description: This game requires an SSD hard drive as 3D models are lazy loaded constantly.
notes: For AMD users: It's recommended to use a virtual desktop as GW2's launcher will slow most desktop environments to a crawl only recoverable by hard reboot. Running GW2's exe with -image lets it download all game data and updates. For convenience, It's recommended to create a context menu entry for updating the game. To improve perfomance, these settings. are suggested. Also, using a fast SSD hard drive can massively reduce, or eliminate stuttering on this game.
content:
files:
- client: https://s3.amazonaws.com/gw2cdn/client/branches/Gw2Setup-64.exe
- gw2shadercache: https://github.com/Zeioth/zeioth-lutris/raw/master/game-installers/guild-wars-2/gw2-d9vk-shader-cache-0.0.2.zip
game:
  arch: win64
  args: -autologin
  exe: drive_c/Program Files/Guild Wars 2/GW2-64.exe
  prefix: $GAMEDIR
installer:
- extract:
    dst: $GAMEDIR
    file: gw2shadercache
    format: zip
- task:
    arch: win64
    description: Creating win64 prefix
    name: create_prefix
    prefix: $GAMEDIR
- task:
    app: faudio
    name: winetricks
    prefix: $GAMEDIR
- execute:
    command: mkdir -p "$GAMEDIR/drive_c/Program Files/Guild Wars 2"
- move:
    dst: $GAMEDIR/drive_c/Program Files/Guild Wars 2/GW2-64.exe
    src: client
system:
  disable_compositor: 'true'
  env:
    DXVK_HUD: 0
    DXVK_LOG_LEVEL: none
    STAGING_SHARED_MEMORY: 1
    __GL_SHADER_DISK_CACHE_PATH: $GAMEDIR
    __NV_PRIME_RENDER_OFFLOAD: 1
wine:
  d9vk: true
  esync: true
